div.p: This guide provides instructions to help you understand, implement, conform to, and label your product in accordance with the xShare Yellow Button.
More contextual information about the xShare Yellow Button, including tools and supporting material can be found at the X-Bundle Registry.
The xShare Yellow Button is a simple way to share your data with a single click.
This guide explains how to understand, implement, and conform to the xShare Yellow Button specification.
It is intended for developers, implementers, and testers of systems that use the xShare Yellow Button.
The xShare Yellow Button enables natural persons to share their health data in European Electronic Health Record Exchange Format (EEHRxF) by offering three main capabilities:

ul.li: The download of their health data
The health data sharing by using a one-time link
The health data sharing by using a link valid for a period of time

div.p: This version of the xShare Yellow Button specification focuses on the first two features.
In the following paragraphs you will find the information you need to

li.a: get started with the xShare Yellow Button

div.p: New readers are encouraged to begin with the one page xShare Yellow Button "get started" pages explaining in a simple and concise way what do you need to do to implement and prove conformance to this guide:

li.a: Get Started with the xShare Yellow Button Download
Get Started with the xShare Yellow Button One-time share

div.p: In fact information described in this guide is organized following the BDAT (business, data, application, and technology) model. Where:

li.p: The business domain describes the business goals, processes and rules the xShare Yellow Button is referring to.
It substantially describes why, how and where to use the xShare Yellow Button, from a users perspective.

ul.li: The data domain describes the data model and the data exchange format.

The application domain describes - in a implementation indipendent form - what are the (software) components involved and how they interact, collaborate, or are coordinated. It also provides an overview of the system architecture.

li.p: The technology domain describes the technology stack and the infrastructure required to support the xShare Yellow Button. This includes technical standards, specifications, and security considerations.
This is where implemantable specifications are described.
